title: RxLocal 12+
appDescription: Manage your medication and save time by downloading our easy-to-use app. Need to manage your family's medication? We've got you covered there too; just add them to our app to save even more time. Order refills, view medication profiles, view our contact options, and don't miss a dose by setting medication reminders directly in our app.

reviews.title: It could be a great app
reviews.review: When I first downloaded this app 8 months ago it was great. I could easily request refills for any family member (including our pets) and I especially liked having a summary of what was ready at the pharmacy so I could double check that when I was picking up. This summer that summary disappeared. I had to manually open each individual family member’s name to see if any of their prescriptions were ready for pickup. Between the people and the pets there are 5 to manually look through. In the past few weeks there was a notice that all users must change their password. Okay. I did. Got in and used it as usual. The next time - all users must changed their password. I did again. Used the app. Then next time and every time following - every user must change their password. I’ve changed it 4 times and still getting that message. I gave up on it. Thankfully my pharmacy has a texting number so I can just text them when I need a refill. This app is useless! more

reviews.title: Helping independent pharmacies compete
reviews.review: Love the concept, it basically seems to do what I need. And I’m so happy my local independent pharmacy has this tool to add some of the convenience of the big corporations. I love my local pharmacy. I get fantastic, caring service from professionals who know my family’s medications and who will advise me directly about important side effects or drug interactions instead of making it my job to read the dense info included. But it feels like an early version of the app. I would like to support the developers with useful feedback without trashing the app in a review. Please allow in app feedback and a feedback channel on the website. Also, better documentation on the website would help. My husband is having trouble creating an account. He entered his correct information but was told it doesn’t match what the pharmacy has on file, which cannot be true. Also I’m trying to add family members. It asks for their Rx number. What is that? How do I discover or obtain one for them? Maybe explain more fully how to do something like that on the website. All you do there is step through the really obvious path as set forth in the app. So, I’d say communication with the developers and ways to get questions answered in more detail would be the first major change to make. more
